conversation.ja_sentence: そのあと、部内でみんなの意向をリサーチすると、ある程度案が絞られる。
conversation.en_sentence: After that, researching the wishes of everyone in the department will help you refine the plan somewhat.

conversation.ja_sentence: たかが部内の親睦会の企画でも、仕事力向上のために必要なスキルがたくさん求められるからね。
conversation.en_sentence: Because even planning a social gathering for the staff demands a lot of the necessary skills you need to improve your proficiency at work.

conversation.ja_sentence: 部長もそれを見越して、新入社員に担当させていると思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I believe that the head of the department anticipates that, and that's why he puts the new recruits in charge.

conversation.ja_sentence: まずは、開催までのスケジュールを立てて、やらないといけないことを洗い出さないとね。
conversation.en_sentence: First of all, you need to create a schedule up to the event, and figure out what you need to do.

conversation.ja_sentence: イベント内容の決定は１ヶ月前くらいに終わらせたいね。
conversation.en_sentence: You'll probably want to finish deciding on the event details about a month beforehand.

conversation.ja_sentence: とりあえず、2週間後の部内ミーティングでプレゼンしてほしいから、そのつもりで準備を進めてもらえるかな。
conversation.en_sentence: For the time being, I would like you to give the presentation in the departmental meeting in two weeks, so can I ask you to start preparing for that?

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンは部長から厳しい指摘がガンガン入るから、一発でクリアはできないと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it's impossible to clear the presentation in one shot, because there comes a lot of intense scrutiny from the head of the department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 覚悟して取りかかってね。
conversation.en_sentence: Please bear that in mind when you prepare for it.
Have you ever noticed that some people seem to just light up a room whenever they walk in?
conversation.ja_sentence: 入ってくるだけでぱあっと部屋が明るくなるような人っていると思わない？

conversation.en_sentence: They radiate confidence.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自信が溢れ出てるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I've been taking a public speaking course.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私スピーチのコースを取ってるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's teaching me a lot about building rapport with people, body language, and presence.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやって人々と信頼関係を築くかとか、ボディーランゲージ、存在感なんかについて沢山教わってるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I can teach you some of the techniques.
conversation.ja_sentence: テクニックをいくつか教えてあげようか。

conversation.en_sentence: For example, today, start up a conversation with someone that you don't know.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、今日知らない人に話しかけるとするよね。

conversation.en_sentence: But, you've done it before.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、前にもやったことがあるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Or else you would have never met anyone new in your whole life.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうじゃなきゃ、人生で一度も誰にも出会ってない事になるでしょ。

conversation.en_sentence: When you go up to talk to them, imagine that they are a very old friend.
conversation.ja_sentence: その人達が古い友達だと想像して話しかけるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Then, instead of introducing yourself, just start talking about anything.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、自己紹介はしないで、何でもいいから何か話し始めちゃうの。

conversation.en_sentence: I usually talk about the first thing that is in front of us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は大体何か目の前にあるものについて話しはじめるわね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, one tip they gave was spending time with people in different places.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、教わったコツの1つは、色々違った場所で人々と過ごすという事よ。

conversation.en_sentence: We always see each other at work, but since we're friends we do other things together as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私達はいつも仕事で会ってるけど、友達だから、他のことも一緒にするでしょ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, and we've both been to each others houses.
conversation.ja_sentence: お互いの家にも行き来するしね。

conversation.en_sentence: So, if you would like to deepen a relationship with someone from work, meet them somewhere else.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから、もし誰か職場の人と関係を深めたかったら、他の場所で会ってみるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Anywhere is fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: どこでもいいの。

conversation.en_sentence: Just go to our company's internal website.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社の社内ウェブに行って。

conversation.en_sentence: You will see an HR tab.
conversation.ja_sentence: 人事部のタブをクリックするでしょ。

conversation.en_sentence: Then you can find the training link.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうするとトレーニングのリンクがあるから。

conversation.en_sentence: Our company reimburses tuition for any training courses on the website up to 2,000 dollars per person per year.
conversation.ja_sentence: そこに載ってるトレーニングコースならなんでも、年間2,000ドルまでは会社から学費が補助されるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, the way they look at it, is if we're learning skills it will make us better employees.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちら従業員のスキルが上がる事は会社にとっても良い事だからね。

conversation.en_sentence: So it's a great benefit for everyone.
conversation.ja_sentence: だからこれはみんなにとって利益になる事なのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Kevin, my name is Alex, and I wanted to talk to you about your position at Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ケビンさん、私はアレックスと申します、A社でのあなたのお仕事についてお話しさせていただきたいと思いまして。

conversation.en_sentence: I will be very up front with you Alex.
conversation.ja_sentence: 単刀直入に申し上げますね、アレックスさん。

conversation.en_sentence: You do really good work, and I was wondering if you would entertain the idea of interviewing for another company.
conversation.ja_sentence: お仕事が大変お出来になるので、他社の面接をお受けになる気がおありかどうかと思いまして。

conversation.en_sentence: How much do you make now?
conversation.ja_sentence: 現在のお給料はどのくらいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It starts at 80,000 a year, but you could probably ask for more.
conversation.ja_sentence: 年俸80,000からスタートということですが、もう少し要求することはできます。

conversation.en_sentence: It's a management position.
conversation.ja_sentence: 管理職になります。

conversation.en_sentence: It would be very similar to what you are doing now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 現在されているお仕事とほぼ同じような内容です。

conversation.en_sentence: Does it sound like something that you would be interested in?
conversation.ja_sentence: ご興味はおありでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm just a recruiter.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はリクルーターです。

conversation.en_sentence: They will call you, then please discuss about the interview schedule.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先方からお電話が行きますので、その時に面接の日時を決めていただくようになります。

conversation.en_sentence: That is fine, I will have them call you after you finish work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解致しました、お仕事が終わってからお電話していただくように伝えます。

conversation.en_sentence: Does tomorrow at 6pm work?
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日の午後6時はいかがでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: How about the day after that?
conversation.ja_sentence: では明後日はどうですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, go ahead.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、どうぞ。

conversation.en_sentence: I can hold.
conversation.ja_sentence: お待ちしております。

conversation.en_sentence: Thursday evening should be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: 木曜日の夕方なら問題ないはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: The person calling you will be Roger.
conversation.ja_sentence: ロジャーさんという方からお電話が行きますので。

conversation.en_sentence: He is the Vice President.
conversation.ja_sentence: その方は副社長さんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, I'm not allowed to say.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら私からは申し上げられないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: They are also being very careful as they are trying to replace a current manager as soon as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、先方は至急現在のマネージャーの後任を見つけなければならないので大変気を使われておりまして。

conversation.en_sentence: Between you and me, that should give you a lot of leverage for this position.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここだけの話ですが、かなり有利なお話だと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't tell them that I told you that though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私がこれを申し上げたということは先方に仰らないでくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: Welcome, Mr.Curtis and Ms.Yamamoto.
conversation.ja_sentence: カーティスさん、山本さん、ようこそ。

conversation.en_sentence: My name is Linda Cullen.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の名前はリンダコリンです。

conversation.en_sentence: I am in charge of training the new employees.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新入社員のトレーニング担当をしています。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you guys ready for the tour of the office?
conversation.ja_sentence: オフィスツアーの準備はいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: This is Customer Service Department where you two will be working.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここがお二人が働く事になる顧客サービス部です。

conversation.en_sentence: You have your own designated desks over there.
conversation.ja_sentence: 個人デスクがあちらにあります。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be shadowing an experienced employee during your first week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初の一週間は、ベテラン従業員の横について学んでください。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure to bring a notepad and a pen to jot down anything you will learn.
conversation.ja_sentence: 学んだことを書き取る為のノートとペンも忘れずに持参してください。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it is on your desk.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、デスクの上に置いてあります。

conversation.en_sentence: We are going next door to get your pictures taken for your employee ID cards.
conversation.ja_sentence: 隣の部屋で従業員IDカードの写真撮影をしましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Your ID has your employee code as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: IDカードには従業員番号も記載されています。

conversation.en_sentence: You will need it for many situations such as logging in on a computer, using a printer, et cetera.
conversation.ja_sentence: この番号は、パソコンにログインしたり印刷機を使用したりする時など、さまざまな場所で必要になります。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be using it so often that you should know it by heart by the end of this week.
conversation.ja_sentence: この番号はとても頻繁に使うので、今週末には自然と覚えているはずですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Before we get your pictures taken, let me show you our breakroom.
conversation.ja_sentence: 写真撮影の前に、休憩室の案内をしますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Our employees really enjoy this breakroom.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの従業員はこの休憩室を大変気に入っています。

conversation.en_sentence: We come here to relax for a little bit.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここにきて少しの間リラックスするんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We will feel so refreshed and go back to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてすっきりして仕事に戻ります。

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, they are regularly refilled by our staff.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、うちのスタッフが定期的に補充します。

conversation.en_sentence: People here are very friendly and willing to help you learn.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここの従業員は皆フレンドリーで喜んで手助けしてくれますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Please do not hesitate to ask me if you have any questions or concerns.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か質問や心配があれば、躊躇せずに聞いてくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: Great to have you both join our team.
conversation.ja_sentence: お二人を迎える事が出来、光栄です。

conversation.en_sentence: Company A, this is Sarah speaking.
conversation.ja_sentence: A会社、サラでございます。

conversation.en_sentence: How may I help you?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういったご用件でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Can I have your order number, please?
conversation.ja_sentence: オーダー番号を教えていただけますでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me pull up your order information.
conversation.ja_sentence: オーダー詳細を調べますね。

conversation.en_sentence: The order detail shows that your package was delivered yesterday.
conversation.ja_sentence: オーダーページによると、昨日品物が配達されているようです。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there any issue with it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か問題がございましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: I am so sorry to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは大変申し訳ございません。

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We are more than happy to issue a full refund to your account.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様のアカウントに直ちに全額返金させて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: Or we can send you a replacement immediately.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしくは代替品をすぐに送る事も可能です。

conversation.en_sentence: Whichever works better for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご都合の良い方をお選びください。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me check the shipping methods.
conversation.ja_sentence: 発送方法をお調べしますね。

conversation.en_sentence: We can send it via Priority Mail and have it delivered by Tuesday.
conversation.ja_sentence: プライオリティメールで発送すると火曜日までに配達されますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We will cover the shipping fee as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん送料はこちらで持たせて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course, we will.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I want you to know that we never intentionally ship defective products.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社が故意に不良品を送る事は絶対にないという事を知って頂きたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: We conduct a thorough quality inspection upon shipping.
conversation.ja_sentence: 発送の際には必ず商品の品質チェックを行っております。

conversation.en_sentence: However, packages can be damaged during delivery.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、発送中にパッケージが損傷を受ける場合もあります。

conversation.en_sentence: I sincerely apologize for that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に申し訳ございませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: We will make sure it will not happen again.
conversation.ja_sentence: このような事が二度と起こらないように気をつけます。

conversation.en_sentence: Also we will send you a confirmation e-mail with a tracking number once the package is shipped.
conversation.ja_sentence: 発送完了しましたら、追跡番号を記載したメールを送信いたします。

conversation.en_sentence: Again I am sorry about the inconvenience.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご迷惑をおかけしてしまい、申し訳ございませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, how are you doing?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも、元気ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm doing well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 元気です。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for taking a few minutes to meet with me this morning.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今朝は時間を作ってくださりありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm glad that we got connected at the alumni dinner the other night.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先日は卒業生の夕食会でお会いすることが出来てうれしかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, well I'm going to go ahead and jump right into it.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、では早速始めようと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll go ahead and give you my business card before we get started.
conversation.ja_sentence: 始める前に、私の名刺を渡しておきますね。

conversation.en_sentence: I had sent you a copy of the power point presentation.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたにパワーポイントのプレゼンテーションのコピーを送っておきました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll go ahead and pull it up to use to navigate.
conversation.ja_sentence: それを使って説明するんで、今出してきますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, here you are.
conversation.ja_sentence: はいどうぞ。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me begin by asking you, what do you know about CRM Product A?
conversation.ja_sentence: まずこの質問からはじめましょう、CRM製品Aについて何かご存知ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I'm excited to tell you all about it a little later.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、後でそれについてたっぷり説明させてもらいますね。

conversation.en_sentence: First, I would like to focus on your Company A, and how quickly you’ve grown in such a short time.
conversation.ja_sentence: まずは、御社A社がこの短期間でどれだけ急成長したかということについてフォーカスしたいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Company A launched in 2015, and during this short period, you have managed to grow your net sales to about 469 million dollars!
conversation.ja_sentence: A社を2015年に立ち上げ、この短期間の間に、純売上高を約4億6900万ドルに成長させることができましたよね！

conversation.en_sentence: Did your team anticipate that sort of growth, or is that something that just kind of happened organically through hard work?
conversation.ja_sentence: そのような成長をチームは予測していましたか、それともただ必死に働くことによって自然にそうなったんでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I understand completely, Dan.
conversation.ja_sentence: よくわかりますよ、ダン。

conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to share a case study with you on one of our clients.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社のある顧客についてのケーススタディをお見せしたいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you familiar with Power Tool Company X?
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたは工具X社をご存知ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: As far as size, they're very similar to your organization.
conversation.ja_sentence: 規模に関してはX社は御社の組織に良く似ています。

conversation.en_sentence: With their inside sales team, our CRM saved them 7 minutes per hour, which adds up to 18 hours per week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 内勤営業部門では、我が社のCRMにより1時間に7分、1週間に最大18時間の作業時間の短縮になりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Looking at their field reps, we are saving them about 15 minutes per hour, which is a total of 30 hours per week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 外回り営業部門に関しては、1時間あたり15分、1週間あたり合計30時間です。

conversation.en_sentence: It's leading them to a 30 percent increase of product orders.
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品注文を30パーセントの増加に導いています。

conversation.en_sentence: You had mentioned that you wanted to expand business.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたはビジネスを拡大したいとおっしゃっていましたよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I have been hearing that rumor for years.
conversation.ja_sentence: その噂なら何年も聞いているよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You have got to be kidding me!
conversation.ja_sentence: 冗談でしょう？

conversation.en_sentence: Out of hundreds of companies, it has to be Y company!
conversation.ja_sentence: 何百とある会社があるのに、Y社なんだ！

conversation.en_sentence: Oh yes, the new CEO will most likely move all the manufacturing jobs abroad.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ、新しい経営者は全ての製造業を海外に移すだろう。

conversation.en_sentence: Y company already has several large factories in China, Bangladesh, and the Philippines.
conversation.ja_sentence: Y社はすでに中国、バングラデシュ、フィリピンに大きな工場を持っているからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, we don't.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもうちはしてないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: All of our products are made here, in the States.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの商品は全てアメリカ国内で生産している。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Dillard takes a pride in offering "Made In USA" products.
conversation.ja_sentence: ディラードさんは「アメリカ産」という商品を提供する事に誇りを持っているんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: And a lot of our customers choose us for the same exact reasons.
conversation.ja_sentence: 顧客の大半は同じ理由でうちの商品を選んでくれている。

conversation.en_sentence: If we start manufacturing overseas, I don't know how the quality of our products is going to be.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし海外で製造する事になったら、品質はどうなるかわからないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's not the point though.
conversation.ja_sentence: そういう事じゃないんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you imagine what will happen if the new CEO decides to close down our factory here?
conversation.ja_sentence: 新しい経営者がうちの工場を閉鎖したらどうなるか想像つく？

conversation.en_sentence: All those factory workers will definitely end up losing their jobs.
conversation.ja_sentence: 工場で働く従業員は皆職を失う事になるのは確かだね。

conversation.en_sentence: My good friend, George, has been there for 24 years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の友人ジョージは24年勤務してるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: He can not afford to be unemployed with two children still in high school.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだ高校生の子供が二人いるから失業なんてできないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: His wife is disabled, so she would not be able to help support those kids.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の奥さんは体に障害があるから、子供達を金銭的にサポートするのは無理。

conversation.en_sentence: He isn't the only one who will be affected negatively.
conversation.ja_sentence: 悪影響を受けるのは彼だけじゃないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Think about the rest of the 250 employees at the factory.
conversation.ja_sentence: 工場勤務の250人の従業員の事を考えてみて。

conversation.en_sentence: Many of them have been loyal and working there for years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多くの人は長年、忠実に勤務してきてるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I wish there was something we could do to prevent the new CEO from shutting down the factory.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新しい経営者が工場を閉鎖するのをどうにかして阻止できればいいんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: We could protest against it along with the factory workers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 工場の従業員と共に抗議してみようか。

conversation.en_sentence: I guess so.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうかもね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Green, I would like to talk to you personally.
conversation.ja_sentence: グリーンさん、個人的に話したい事があります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: I do not really want to do this, but somebody needs to step up and do it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当はこういう事をやりたくないのですが、誰かがしないといけない事です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it is about Cameron.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、キャメロンについてです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Susan, Kazu, Yuka, and I collectively decided that we want him off the project.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼を外して欲しいとスーザン、カズ、ゆか、私の全員で決断しました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: He appears that way to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたにはそう見えますよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: I just want to let you know I am not here to tattle on him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が彼の告げ口をしているという訳ではないんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: We want you to know what's going on behind the scenes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 裏で一体何が起こっているかを知ってもらいたいんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Cameron always makes us do all the work.
conversation.ja_sentence: キャメロンはいつも私たちに全ての仕事をさせているんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Then he takes all the credit.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、功績は自分のものにするんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: He had Kazu do all the research for him.
conversation.ja_sentence: カズが全てのリサーチをさせられてました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Susan ended up finishing up the Power Point slide show.
conversation.ja_sentence: パワーポイントのスライドショーはスーザンが仕上げる羽目になりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: I got all the presentation materials ready for him too.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、プレゼンの準備は私がしました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: He pretends to be working extra hard when you are around.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたがいる時は、真面目にしっかり働いている振りをしていますからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know what he does on his computer most of the time?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼はいつもパソコンで何をしているか知っていますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: He is either on social media or doing some online shopping.
conversation.ja_sentence: ソーシャルメディアかオンラインショッピングをしているんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: I like him as a friend, but he should not be trusted with this project.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の事は友人としては好きですが、このプロジェクトに携わるべき人材ではありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: The rest of us truly cares about the success of this project.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残りの皆はこのプロジェクトが成功する事を真剣に考えています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: We work night and day making sure everything you assign us gets complete in time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 与えられた仕事をきちんと予定通り終わるように朝から晩まで真面目に働いています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: But Cameron!
conversation.ja_sentence: でもキャメロンったら！

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: He is being as lazy as he can be.
conversation.ja_sentence: 怠けすぎです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your kind understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解頂き有難うございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイミー ハート
conversation.en_sentence: Now I feel like we can just focus on the project without distractions.
conversation.ja_sentence: やっとプロジェクトに集中する事ができます。

conversation.en_sentence: Mostly, yes.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、大体は。

conversation.en_sentence: I still have a few things I need to take care of though.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだ幾つかしなければいけない事はあるんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Like finding a really good family doctor and a dentist.
conversation.ja_sentence: 評判の良いファミリードクターと歯医者を見つけたりですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I will certainly do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうしてみます。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I have met them all.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、全員会いました。

conversation.en_sentence: They have been very welcoming and made me feel very comfortable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん歓迎してくださって、とても居心地が良いです。

conversation.en_sentence: I noticed the people in this town are generally hospitable.
conversation.ja_sentence: この町の人はとても親切なんですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Every time I have a problem, there is always someone who is willing to lend me a hand.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か困った事があると、必ず誰かが助けてくれます。

conversation.en_sentence: And the people here seem more relaxed and care-free.
conversation.ja_sentence: それとここの人たちはのんびりしていて大らかな感じがします。

conversation.en_sentence: I got to experience my first Halloween and Thanksgiving in the States.
conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカで初めてのハロウィンと感謝祭を経験しました。

conversation.en_sentence: The fact everybody at the office dressed up for Halloween was something that I am not used to.
conversation.ja_sentence: オフィスの皆さんが仮装して出勤されたのが新鮮でした。

conversation.en_sentence: Some people do, but definitely not at work.
conversation.ja_sentence: する人もいますが、職場でやる事はないですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Japanese workplace environments are a bit more serious in general.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一般的に日本の職場はにもう少し真剣な感じです。

conversation.en_sentence: You guys are just as hardworking.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなた方も同じ位真面目に働いていますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Also the potluck we did for Thanksgiving was amazing.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、感謝祭の持ち寄りパーティーもとても良かったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Not only I got to try the traditional Thanksgiving food, but also I got to mingle with my new coworkers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 伝統的な感謝祭料理も味わうことができたし、新しい同僚とも親しくなれました。

conversation.en_sentence: I had a great time getting to know each and every one of them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼ら一人一人を個人的に知る事ができて楽しいひと時でした。

conversation.en_sentence: I am looking forward to participating in that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一緒に行ける事を楽しみにしています。

conversation.en_sentence: To be honest with you, I was very nervous about transferring here at first.
conversation.ja_sentence: 正直なところ、初めはここに転勤して来る事が心配でした。

conversation.en_sentence: But you guys helped make my transition very smooth.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもあなた方のおかげでスムーズな移行ができました。

conversation.en_sentence: I can not thank you enough for that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に感謝しています。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much again.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Ms. Bowden, I need you to go to the job fair at the convention center next Thursday.
conversation.ja_sentence: ボウデンさん、来週の木曜日にコンベンションセンターで開催される就職説明会に行ってもらいたいんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you also take Mr. Terry with you?
conversation.ja_sentence: テリーさんも同行してもいいかな？

conversation.en_sentence: You have been to this type of job fair a few times before.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は就職説明会には何度も参加しているよね。

conversation.en_sentence: So you know the drill, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: もう何をすれば良いかは把握しているはずだね？

conversation.en_sentence: I want you to pick at least 5 candidates to interview this time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は面接できそうな志願者を最低5人探して欲しい。

conversation.en_sentence: I would like to expand our public relations and marketing department.
conversation.ja_sentence: 人事部と販売部の規模を拡大しようと思っているんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: As always, we need someone who is bilingual in English and Japanese.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも通り、英語と日本語のバイリンガル。

conversation.en_sentence: If you can find someone who also has a good command of Spanish, that would be a big advantage.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしスペイン語が流暢な人がいたら、有利だね。

conversation.en_sentence: I assume most of the applicants have Bachelor's degrees.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大抵の志願者は学士号を持っているはずなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: So I am really looking for someone with a Master's.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから、修士号を持っている人が望ましい。

conversation.en_sentence: It doesn't have to be MBA.
conversation.ja_sentence: MBAじゃなくても良いんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Master's in Marketing or Public Relations will be just as fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: マーケティングか広報でも大丈夫。

conversation.en_sentence: Any significant achievement is a plus.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大きな業績があるとプラスだね。

conversation.en_sentence: At least 3 years of experience in the field is a must.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最低でもこの業界で3年の経験は必要。

conversation.en_sentence: Preferably more than 5 years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 希望は5年以上。

conversation.en_sentence: And someone who is driven and well likable.
conversation.ja_sentence: あとはやる気があって人当たりが良い人がいいな。

conversation.en_sentence: Please do.
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Depending on the experience, the salaries will start around $45000 a year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経験にもよるけど、年収45000ドルから始めてもらう予定だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have a suggestion for that?
conversation.ja_sentence: 提案はあるかい？

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, that's fine with me.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、それで大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: Also this will be Mr. Terry's first job fair.
conversation.ja_sentence: それからテリーさんにとって今回が初めての就職説明会になる。

conversation.en_sentence: I want you to teach him the ins and outs of it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんと詳細を教えてあげてね。

conversation.en_sentence: Dave, can we sit down and discuss tomorrow's agenda?
conversation.ja_sentence: デイブ、明日の議題について座って話し合うことができる？

conversation.en_sentence: Come on Dave.
conversation.ja_sentence: おいおいデイブ。

conversation.en_sentence: Tomorrow is a big deal.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日は大変なんだから。

conversation.en_sentence: Not only will everyone in the building be attending, but the entire company at the other offices will be watching remotely.
conversation.ja_sentence: 建物内の全員が参加するだけでなく、他のオフィスの会社全体がリモートで見るんだからね。

conversation.en_sentence: OK, so first we're going to start with introductions, but they need to be quick.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、最初は紹介から始めよう、だけど手短にね。

conversation.en_sentence: I figured we would introduce everyone here in the Austin office first.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初にオースティンのオフィスのみんなを紹介したほうがいいと思うんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りだね。

conversation.en_sentence: Then, we'll have the other offices run through their rosters.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、他のオフィスで名簿を確認してもらって。

conversation.en_sentence: Followed by remote workers.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのあとは在宅従業員だね。

conversation.en_sentence: Since everyone will be at their desk, they can each do a quick introduction from their laptop camera.
conversation.ja_sentence: みんな席についているから、それぞれ自分のラップトップカメラから簡単な自己紹介をすることができるね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes I have.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、済ませたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It should be fun.
conversation.ja_sentence: きっと楽しくなるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Tim is going to route everyones' cameras to everyone elses’ screens.
conversation.ja_sentence: ティムはみんなのカメラをほかのみんなのスクリーンにつなぐ予定だ。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I like that idea Dave.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、それが良いと思うよデイブ。

conversation.en_sentence: Originally, I had intended on doing recognition for goals met, but I think it would be overkill right after introductions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当初は目標達成の表彰をしようと思っていたんだけど、紹介の直後ではやり過ぎだろうと思って。

conversation.en_sentence: No, I haven't.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいや、まだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks for reminding me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 思い出させてくれてありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: I should copy Tim on those as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: ティムもコピーするべきだね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, as it will contain the decks that the reps will show prospects during their demonstrations.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、デモンストレーションの間に担当者が見込み客について話すデッキを含むから。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope so.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだといいね。

conversation.en_sentence: I know that meetings here tend to go long, but we really only should spend about two hours on this.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここでの会議は長引く傾向があるけれど、２時間位で終わらせるべきだな。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I'm good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫だと思うよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Tony come on in.
conversation.ja_sentence: トニー、入ってください。

conversation.en_sentence: No, no not at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、全然大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: My door is always open for you and everyone on my team.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私に話があればいつでもどうぞ。

conversation.en_sentence: What's up?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: What about it?
conversation.ja_sentence: ボーナスがどうかしたんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: You do excellent work Tony.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたは素晴らしい仕事をしていますよ、トニー。

conversation.en_sentence: The thing is though, I just don't have the authority to increase your bonus.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど問題は、私にボーナスを上げる権限がないということです。

conversation.en_sentence: Trust me, if I could, I would.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当ですよ、出来ればしています。

conversation.en_sentence: Tony, this is a really large corporation.
conversation.ja_sentence: トニー、我が社は実に大きな企業です。

conversation.en_sentence: It's all just Company A policy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全てA社の方針なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm just middle management.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はただの中間管理職ですから。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh come on Tony.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと待ってくださいよ、トニー。

conversation.en_sentence: You're making pretty good money these days.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたは最近結構良い金額を稼いでいます。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't throw it all away just because you're in a bad mood.
conversation.ja_sentence: 気分が悪いからといってそれをすべて投げ出さないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I can talk to Bill Higgins, he's an old friend of mine and he's the CFO.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、ビル・ヒギンズに話してみましょうか、彼は私の旧友でありCFOですから。

conversation.en_sentence: I feel your pain.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かります。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me talk to Bill and find out what he says.
conversation.ja_sentence: とりあえずビルに話してみますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How would you feel about a base increase instead of a bonus increase?
conversation.ja_sentence: ボーナスが上がるのではなく、ベースが上がるとしたらどう思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Hard work deserves recognition.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一生懸命働いている事は認識されるべきですからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Besides, Bill owes me a favor.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、ビルには貸しがあるからね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure I can convince him to give you more yearly.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの年棒を上げるように説得する自信はあるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: How much more a year do you think you deserve?
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分であとどの位の年棒に値すると思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's why I scheduled this meeting with you today Jill.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、今日この面談を予定したのはそのためです。

conversation.en_sentence: As the head of HR here in Austin, it made the most sense to talk to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: オースティンの人事部長であるあなたと話をするのが筋だと思いまして。

conversation.en_sentence: I really do appreciate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I know that comes as a bit of a shock to everyone.
conversation.ja_sentence: みんながちょっとしたショックを受けていることは知っています。

conversation.en_sentence: I just really want to get into sales.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は本当に営業に入りたいだけなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I want more money.
conversation.ja_sentence: もっとお金が欲しいんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, so it's not just the money.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、なのでお金だけの問題じゃないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Most of these reps have no idea what they're selling.
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業担当者のほとんどは、彼らが何を売っているのか良くわかっていないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: This software is about CRISPR.
conversation.ja_sentence: このソフトウェアはCRISPRについてです。

conversation.en_sentence: No, not Crisper as in keeping your fruits and vegetables at their best longer.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、果物や野菜を最適な状態に保つあのクリスパーではありません。

conversation.en_sentence: It's a way to change DNA.
conversation.ja_sentence: DNAを変える方法なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: It allows you to edit genomes!
conversation.ja_sentence: これによってゲノムを編集することができるんです！

conversation.en_sentence: Not at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全然違います。

conversation.en_sentence: It could be used to treat a lot of diseases.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは様々な病気を治療するために使用できるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: And as of now, our software that teaches this isn't selling at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして今のところ、その教育用のソフトはまったく売れていません。

conversation.en_sentence: Despite being a masterpiece.
conversation.ja_sentence: 傑作であるにもかかわらず。

conversation.en_sentence: It's the reps!
conversation.ja_sentence: それは営業担当者のせいです！

conversation.en_sentence: The thing that drives me crazy though is that I know they are making way more money than me!
conversation.ja_sentence: 一番腹が立つのは、彼らが私よりもずっとお金を稼いでいるということですよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Look, it's a win win.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良く考えてください、どちらにとっても良い話だと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: What paper work do I need to fill out.
conversation.ja_sentence: どの書類に記入すれば良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Great, I'm ready to start ASAP.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね、大至急はじめたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: All of my files have been shared with the Chemistry team, so I can leave at any time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私のファイルはすべて化学チームと共有しているので、いつでもチームを去ることができます。

conversation.en_sentence: Today, we will begin our month long webinar campaign.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日より、私達は一か月にわたるウェビナーキャンペーンを始めます。

conversation.en_sentence: It's like a seminar but online, hence the name webinar.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはセミナーのようなものですが、オンラインなのでウェビナーと呼びます。

conversation.en_sentence: Dr. Merriwether will be discussing tactics for student retention and attrition.
conversation.ja_sentence: ドクターメリウェザーが、学生の維持と減少においての戦術について議論します。

conversation.en_sentence: He will also be discussing how to foster campus community through programs, resources, and involvement opportunities.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、プログラム、リソース、そして参加の機会を通して、キャンパスコミュニティをどのように育んでいくかについても議論します。

conversation.en_sentence: After the presentation, participants will be invited to ask questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンテーションの後、参加者の質問を受け付けます。

conversation.en_sentence: No, we will be targeting Provosts, Vice Principals, and the department of student affairs.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、プロボスト、副校長、および学務部がターゲットです。

conversation.en_sentence: They're mostly in charge of the university's academic and budgetary affairs, but they also play a really big role in student retention.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは主に大学の学務と予算関係を担当していますが、学生の維持にも非常に大きな役割を果たしています。

conversation.en_sentence: The less students a university has, the less money they make.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大学にいる学生が少なければ、彼らの稼ぎは減りますからね。

conversation.en_sentence: This is a pain point to bring up in your conversations with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: このペインポイントから会話に持っていくんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Having Dr. Merriwether on board gives us a lot of credibility.
conversation.ja_sentence: メリウェザー博士を迎える事で私達は高い信頼を得ることができます。

conversation.en_sentence: During the presentation, he will also discuss Product A, which is our student retention software.
conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンテーション中に、彼は学生維持ソフトウェアである製品Aについても話します。

conversation.en_sentence: All of the schools data about students is collected, grades, attendance, age, extra curricular activities, student loan debt, etc.
conversation.ja_sentence: 成績、出席、年齢、特別カリキュラム活動、学生ローンの借金など、学生に関する学校の全てのデータが集められます。

conversation.en_sentence: The data is combined, and creates a profile for each student.
conversation.ja_sentence: データが集約され、各生徒のプロファイルが作成されます。

conversation.en_sentence: Through predictive analytics, the student affairs team can see which students may need extra help, or consulting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 予測分析を通して、学生事務チームはどの学生が特別なヘルプを必要としているか、あるいは助言を必要としているかを知ることができます。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me ask you this Louise, what's the average yearly tuition at a state university these days?
conversation.ja_sentence: ルイーズ、君に聞くけれど、最近の州立大学での年間平均授業料はいくらだと思う？

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly, that's for one student.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通り、それは一人の学生分だね。

conversation.en_sentence: And listen close, because here's the sales pitch.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここからが売り文句なので、よく聞いてください。

conversation.en_sentence: What if you could save just one student?
conversation.ja_sentence: もし一人の生徒だけを救うことができたらどうなりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: The school would save $15,000.
conversation.ja_sentence: 学校は15,000ドルセーブできますね。

conversation.en_sentence: What if this software could save one hundred students?
conversation.ja_sentence: このソフトウェアが100人の学生を救うことができたらどうなりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: It retails at $20,000. However, we intend on giving all of the schools a special 10% discount.
conversation.ja_sentence: 小売価格は2万ドルです。しかし、私たちはすべての学校に10％の特別割引を与えるつもりです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: So, I'll be talking today about trade compliance in regards to export and import.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、輸出入に関する貿易コンプライアンスについてお話したいと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: When you plan on exporting a product, there are several things you have to consider.
conversation.ja_sentence: ある商品の輸出を計画する場合、考慮しなければいけないことがいくつかあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: One of the most important things is to figure out what the HS code is.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最も重要なことの一つは、HSコードを理解することです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: The HS code is the harmonized commodity description which is used in most country to identify a product.
conversation.ja_sentence: HSコードは、ほとんどの国で商品分類に使用されている国際統一商品分類です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Depending on the HS code, the importing country may have duties.
conversation.ja_sentence: HSコードによって輸入国は関税を課せられる場合があります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: So it is important to see if the product you want to buy or sell will have duties or not.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですから、売買したい商品が関税対象かどうか調べることが大事です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can either ask the government agency or just ask me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 政府機関に聞いてもいいですし、私に聞いていただいても良いです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: There are cases when a variation of a product may have a higher duty than another.
conversation.ja_sentence: ある商品のバリエーションの方が関税が高くなる場合などもあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Say for example, a petroleum candle has a fourteen percent duty.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、石油キャンドルの関税は14パーセントです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: But a waxed candle may have a five percent duty.
conversation.ja_sentence: が、ワックスキャンドルは5％くらいになります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: I would recommend if the manufacturer can make the candle so it is made of fifty one percent wax and forty nine percent petroleum.
conversation.ja_sentence: メーカーがキャンドルを製造するとしたら、51％がワックスで49％が石油でできた商品をお勧めします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: That way, it will be considered a waxed candle and have a lower duty.
conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、商品はワックスキャンドルとみなされ、関税が安くなります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: We call this tariff engineering.
conversation.ja_sentence: これを関税エンジニアリングと呼びます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Next, I will talk a bit about the country of origin for a product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次に、商品の原産地についてお話しします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: It is easy to determine the country of origin for a product for products without parts.
conversation.ja_sentence: パーツのない製品の原産地を決定するのは簡単です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: But if a product consists of various parts, it may be a bit complicated.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、様々なパーツからなる製品の場合、ちょっと複雑になります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: For example, if a computer has most of its parts made in China, but assembled in Japan, the product would be of Chinese origin.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、コンピューターのほとんどのパーツが中国製の場合は、日本で組み立てられても製品は中国製となります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: So for example, if a log is shipped from Japan to China, and the log is made into a table.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、例えば、木材が日本から中国へ輸送され、テーブルに加工されたとします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Because it is a completely different product, it will be considered a major transformation.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは完全に違う商品なので、大幅な商品転換とみなされます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Therefore the country of origin for this table will now be China instead of Japan where the log originated from.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですから、このテーブルの原産地は、木材の原産地である日本ではなく中国になります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Again, it is important to note that it has to become a completely different product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 繰り返しになりますが、完全に違う商品になったことを認識することが大事です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Any questions so far?
conversation.ja_sentence: ここまでで何かご質問はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Hi there, this is Sam Lee from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のサム リーと申します。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm good thanks!
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、どうも。

conversation.en_sentence: Happy New Year by the way.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、あけましておめでとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you have a nice holiday break?
conversation.ja_sentence: 良いお正月休みでしたか？

conversation.en_sentence: You mentioned last time you had plans on travelling, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 前回、旅行に行かれると話しておられましたが。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds nice.
conversation.ja_sentence: わー、いいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: No, I had to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、仕事でした。

conversation.en_sentence: There were some issues with the shipment over the holidays.
conversation.ja_sentence: 休み中に船積みにちょっと問題がありまして。

conversation.en_sentence: One of the vessels got delayed which meant the arrival date would be later than what my customer requested.
conversation.ja_sentence: 船が一隻遅れまして、それで客先が望んでいたよりも到着日が遅れそうになってしまったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: So I had to scramble to find an alternative.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、急いで別の手段を見つけなければいけなくて。

conversation.en_sentence: Luckily, the freight forwarder that I work with has good connections with the shipping lines.
conversation.ja_sentence: 運良く、一緒に仕事している乙仲が船会社にコネを持っていて。

conversation.en_sentence: They managed to book me a vessel at the last minute.
conversation.ja_sentence: 寸前に別の船を予約させてくれたんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I know, so I was in panic mode when I learned that the vessel was delayed.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんです、なので、遅れたって聞いてパニックになってしまったんんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I need to keep this in mind for next time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次回はよく覚えておかなきゃ。

conversation.en_sentence: Anyways, I wanted to give you an update on our next shipment.
conversation.ja_sentence: ともかく、次の出荷について最新情報をお知らせします。

conversation.en_sentence: Our customer in China hasn't given us the shipment schedule but I think it will be similar to last year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 中国の客先はまだ出荷スケジュールを連絡してこないのですが、去年と同じような感じだと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Our first shipment last year was after Chinese New Year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 去年の初出荷は、旧正月の後でした。

conversation.en_sentence: Chinese New Year is in early February.
conversation.ja_sentence: 2月初めの旧正月です。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll let you know once the schedule is set.
conversation.ja_sentence: スケジュールが決まりましたら、ご連絡しますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I think it will be around seven to ten containers.
conversation.ja_sentence: コンテナ７基から１０基くらいじゃないでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: It will depend on how much import quota they can get.
conversation.ja_sentence: 輸入割り当てをどのくらい得られるかによります。

conversation.en_sentence: Will do.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I think you are perfect for the position.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、あなたがこのポジションには最適だと思うんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not just talking about Multinational team, I'm talking about the entire Sales Group.
conversation.ja_sentence: 単に多国籍チームについてだけ話しているんじゃないですよ、営業グループ全体についての話です。

conversation.en_sentence: This may be a good opportunity to restructure the Sales Group.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは営業グループを再編成するいい機会かも知れません。

conversation.en_sentence: So although I was initially thinking just team leaders and abolishing group manager, maybe we should have an experienced group manager after all, so team leader positions could be given to more recent hires.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、当初はグループマネージャーをなくしてチームリーダーだけにしようと考えたのですが、結局のところ、経験のあるグループマネージャーを置いて、チームリーダーのポジションをもっと最近雇った人たちに提供するのがいいでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: You may take over her entire package.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女に関するすべてのことを引き継いでくれれば。

conversation.en_sentence: Pay, benefits, the whole nine yards, so to speak.
conversation.ja_sentence: 給与、手当、言うならば、一切合切です。

conversation.en_sentence: First and foremost, she doesn't want any more responsibilities.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何よりもまず、彼女はこれ以上の責任を抱えたくありません。

conversation.en_sentence: She has made that clear.
conversation.ja_sentence: それははっきり言われました。

conversation.en_sentence: You do know she has a special needs son, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女が特別支援が必要な息子さんをお持ちなのは知ってますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: She wants family time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 家族との時間が欲しいのです。

conversation.en_sentence: Second of all, it's about time you're rewarded for your work.
conversation.ja_sentence: その次に、そろそろあなたの仕事ぶりが報われてもよい頃でしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: You mention that often.
conversation.ja_sentence: よく言ってますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Not so, I went to Cambridge.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうでもないですよ、私はケンブリッジへ行ったんですから。

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko loves people who graduated high caliber schools.
conversation.ja_sentence: 恵子さんが優秀な学校の卒業生が好きなんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: She thinks it's an indication of something.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はそれが何かの兆候だと考えているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: To me it's an indication of nothing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私にとって、それは何の印でもないんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: All I care about are results.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が気にするのは結果だけですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You have built up the Small Cap group all by yourself.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたは、自分一人で中小企業グループを築き上げてきました。

conversation.en_sentence: You have enough experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経験も豊富です。

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko speaks highly of you and this one is my decision.
conversation.ja_sentence: 恵子さんはあなたのことを高く評価していますし、これは私の決断です。

conversation.en_sentence: All I have to do is have Sylvester's approval and I'm confident I can get this through.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私に必要なことは、シルベスターさんの承認をもらうだけですが、これは出来ると自信があります。

conversation.en_sentence: So are you in?
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、話に乗ってくれますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, it's about time someone around here takes that on.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです、そろそろここでも誰かがそれをやってくれる頃かなと思っていました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, they don't have any centralized system here, so, here, I use this template and have everyone else use it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、一元化されたシステムがここにはないので、えっと、ここです、このテンプレートを使って、皆にも使ってもらっています。

conversation.en_sentence: At the end of the month, they all send me their sheets, and I have it merged.
conversation.ja_sentence: 月末になると皆が全員私にシートを送ってきて、私が一つに統合します。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I send the entire folder to one member of the team and that person does the merging.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、フォルダー全体をチームメンバーの一人に送り、その人が統合してくれています。

conversation.en_sentence: Everyone takes turns with it each month, so they all know what to do and can also see others' results.
conversation.ja_sentence: 毎月、順番にやってもらうので、全員がやり方を知っていて、他の人たちの結果を見ることができます。

conversation.en_sentence: Just Small Cap.
conversation.ja_sentence: 中小企業グループだけです。

conversation.en_sentence: John does his own thing with his Multinational team.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョンさんは、多国籍チームで彼自身のやり方でやっています。

conversation.en_sentence: But basically what John does is similar.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、基本的にジョンさんも似たようなことをしています。

conversation.en_sentence: Template was made by Mari, and she started this whole process of taking turns merging.
conversation.ja_sentence: 真理さんがテンプレートを作って、順番に統合をするというこのやり方を始めました。

conversation.en_sentence: When I joined she gave me the sheet so I edited it for Small Cap use and it morphed into something slightly different than the Multinational's.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が入社した時、このシートを彼女にもらい、小口投資グループ用に私が編集して、多国籍チームのものとは少し違ったものにしました。

conversation.en_sentence: She left a legacy for sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに彼女は遺産を残していきました。

conversation.en_sentence: On the sheet?
conversation.ja_sentence: シート上でですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Ours have a lot more information because we deal directly with the end users.
conversation.ja_sentence: エンドユーザーと直接かかわるので、私たちのもののほうが情報が多いです。

conversation.en_sentence: So things like factory specifications and actual machines the widgets are used in.
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり、工場仕様やウィジェットが使われている実際の機械などです。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, if you look at it that way…
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、そういう風に見れば...

conversation.en_sentence: It's more for conversational purposes.
conversation.ja_sentence: これはどちらかというと会話目的なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Those info won't leave the Small Cap Group, and I won't want them integrated into a company wide database.
conversation.ja_sentence: これらの情報は中小企業グループ外には出ないですし、全社データベースには融合したくないです。

conversation.en_sentence: Not really, I don't know any, actually.
conversation.ja_sentence: 特にないです、というか、全く知らないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: So on a different note, John told me he's leaving.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、話が変わるんですが、ジョンから辞めることを聞きました。

conversation.en_sentence: So who's filling his spot?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、誰が彼の後を継ぐんでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: So Mari used to head Multinationals, then John took over 6 months ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり真理さんが昔は多国籍のリーダーで、６カ月前にジョンさんが引き継いだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm feeling Eugina is going to eventually bail as well if she's forced to take it, so it's like a rotating door.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし無理やり引き継がされたら、ユージニアさんも最終的には辞めてしまうでしょうね、まるで回転ドアのように。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi there I'm Kelly Lezzer from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもこんにちは、私はA社のケリー レザーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can call me Kelly then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、ケリーと呼んでください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So what brings you to this trade show?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、なぜこの展示会にいらっしゃったのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Excellent choice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 素晴らしい選択ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: This is one of the biggest trade show in the country.
conversation.ja_sentence: この展示会は国内でも一番大きいものの一つですからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure you'll be able to network and meet interesting companies.
conversation.ja_sentence: 沢山の面白い会社と出会い、繋がることができると思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well we are a wholesale company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我々は卸売会社です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So we distribute products to businesses.
conversation.ja_sentence: 企業向けに製品を販売しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: We only sell to businesses.
conversation.ja_sentence: 企業にのみ販売しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well we are based in Arizona right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええと、今の拠点はアリゾナです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: But we are planning to expand to other states like California and Texas.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかしカリフォルニアやテキサス等、他の州にも広げていこうと思っています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that sounds very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですね、とても興味深いです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Where are you based out of?
conversation.ja_sentence: どこを拠点にしているのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe you can drop by our office one day.
conversation.ja_sentence: よかったらいつかうちのオフィスに立ち寄って下さい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: We can give you a tour of our site and maybe have a meeting with our CEO.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちの会社の案内をさせていただき、おそらく弊社のCEOとの会議もできると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, here's mine as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、私のもどうぞ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it would be great if you can send your company presentation over.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、もし御社のプレゼンをこちらに送っていただけるようでしたら、嬉しいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: And maybe we can start our discussion over email.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、よかったらEメールで話し合いを始めましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure our CEO would be interested in talking to a company like yours.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちのCEOも、御社と会議をすることに興味を持ってくれると思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケリー レザーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Nice meeting you as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ、お会いできて良かったです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi there, this is Ben Sherman from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、Ａ会社のベン シャーマンです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How are you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: お元気ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I am calling today in regards to your application for a logistic assistant.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日は物流管理アシスタントへの応募の件でお電話しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Would you be available to do a quick phone interview?
conversation.ja_sentence: 手短にお電話で面接をする時間はありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: よかった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's get started then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では始めましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I see that you have some past experiences working for a shipping line.
conversation.ja_sentence: 海運会社でお勤めされていたご経験がありますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me what you did?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのようなことをしていたか教えてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me why you are looking for a new job?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして新しい仕事を探しているのか教えてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_sentence: 須藤さん、こないだ受けていただいた検診の結果なんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Sudo-san, can I talk to you about the result of the check-up you took last time?

conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながらそうなんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 血圧の上が160とかなり高めですね、自分でも苦しくはないんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: You're blood pressure at its peak is 160 and is on the high side, is there anything that you feel uncomfortable?

conversation.ja_sentence: 男性の適正値は130なのでちょっとこの数値は改善していく必要がありますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: The standard figure for a male is 130 so there is a need to make this number better.

conversation.ja_sentence: それと腹囲も100センチを超えています。
conversation.en_sentence: And you're abdominal circumference is over 100 centimeters.

conversation.ja_sentence: いわゆるメタボですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Basically you're overweight.

conversation.ja_sentence: メタボの原因は生活習慣病です。
conversation.en_sentence: The reason for being overweight is related to your lifestyle.

conversation.ja_sentence: 言い換えれば生活習慣さえ変えれば治るってことなんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: In other words, it can be fixed if you change your lifestyle.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私がそれを指導していけたらと考えています。
conversation.en_sentence: I would like to give you instructions on this.

conversation.ja_sentence: それではまず、食事の内容を教えていただけますか？
conversation.en_sentence: First of all, can you tell me what you eat?

conversation.ja_sentence: 外食では何を召し上がることが多いですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you usually eat when you eat out?

conversation.ja_sentence: 食べるのはラーメンだけですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you only eat ramen?

conversation.ja_sentence: どのようなつまみを選んでいますか？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you usually order with your drink?

conversation.ja_sentence: 厳しいことを言うようですが、この生活を続けていくと後5年で倒れるかもしれません。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't want to sound so harsh but if you keep this lifestyle up, your body might fail on you in 5 years.

conversation.ja_sentence: 急には難しいのでゆっくりと変えていきましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: It's hard to change right away but let's start changing things slowly.

conversation.ja_sentence: まず朝ごはんはしっかり食べてください。
conversation.en_sentence: First, make sure you eat breakfast.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今は朝食べていないので昼に異常にたくさん食べている状態です。
conversation.en_sentence: Currently, you don't eat breakfast so you eat a lot during lunch.

conversation.ja_sentence: 昼は単品ではなく、定食にしてバランス良い食事を心がけてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Instead of ordering single-items for lunch, please make it into a set meal and make an effort to eat a more balanced meal.

conversation.ja_sentence: 夜の居酒屋の回数も週2ぐらいにして、なるべく家でしっかり食べてください。
conversation.en_sentence: For the evening, limit yourself to going to bars 2 times a week, and try to eat at home.

conversation.ja_sentence: それから居酒屋のつまみはフライ系の油モノではなく、枝豆や冷奴を選ぶと良いですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: And instead of ordering oily deep-fried snacks at the bar, ordering things like edamame and chilled tofu would be good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 食べてすぐ寝るのは良くないのでお茶漬けはやめましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Sleeping right away is not good so let's hold off on the ochazuke.

conversation.ja_sentence: 運動よりもまずはこれらの食事制限から始めてみてはいかがでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about we start but controlling what you eat first rather than focusing on exercising.

conversation.ja_sentence: 後藤さん、今日上がりじゃないんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I thought you were done for the day, Kento?

conversation.ja_sentence: 後藤さんって、来年いっぱいでしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Your contract will end at the end of next year, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: あー、通常研究者って有期雇用だから、面倒ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Argh, that's the thing about researchers, usually with fixed-term contracts.

conversation.ja_sentence: 科研費5年単位なの、どうにかなんないすかね、プロジェクト10年設定とかなのに。
conversation.en_sentence: Isn't there anything that could be done about that 5-year-term for KAKENHI fund, since most of the projects runs for 10 years or longer?

conversation.ja_sentence: でもこのN研究機構は総務省とか色々コネあるから研究もやりやすい方じゃないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: But we're lucky this C National Institute has connections to places like MIC, so we can work in a pretty good environment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 予算十分な研究所って少ないし、間違えて金集まんない所選んじゃうと悲惨ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: There aren't many labs with sufficient budget so it would be pretty harsh if you accidentally choose one of those places that can't raise funds.

conversation.ja_sentence: ほらーって、もしかして、後藤さん、海外の研究所も視野に入れてるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: See, oh, I might be wrong but are you looking at laboratories abroad as well?

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は日本に居たい人なんで、国分寺の駅から遠いのはやだなあ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm a kind of guy who'd like to stay in Japan, and I don't want to get farther from Kokubunji station.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、まじめな話、日本の研究所も悪くないですよ、特許でかなり上手く運営してるK大学の研究所とか。
conversation.en_sentence: But, seriously, laboratories in Japan are not bad, like the one in K university which is doing pretty well with patents.

conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカ考えてるんなら、僕の大学同期がC工科大学に居て、アジア人多くて馴染みやすいって言ってましたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: If you're thinking of going to the States, a friend of mine from college is at C Institute of Technology now, and says it's pretty comfortable with bunch of Asian people.

conversation.ja_sentence: それにアジア系研究者が結構成果出してるって聞いてます。
conversation.en_sentence: He also says quite a few Asian researchers are producing results there.

conversation.ja_sentence: 後藤さんなら優秀な研究者だし、英語も堪能だから、あっちでも大丈夫ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: You're an excellent researcher and a fluent English speaker, I'm sure you'd have no problem moving there.

conversation.ja_sentence: 奥さんも海外留学してた事あるんでしょ？
conversation.en_sentence: Your wife has also studied abroad, hasn't she?

conversation.ja_sentence: それでも単身赴任は選択肢にないんですよね？
conversation.en_sentence: But moving there alone is not your option, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: どうせ慣れるのに苦労するなら、いっそヨーロッパで就職しちゃうのはどうですか、スウェーデンのK研究所とか。
conversation.en_sentence: If you'd have hard time getting used to things, you might as well find a job in Europe, like K Institute in Sweden.

conversation.ja_sentence: ドイツのM-P研究所はどうですか、あそこなら幅広い分野の研究者が居ますよね？
conversation.en_sentence: How about M-P Institute in Germany, they have researchers from a wide variety of fields, don't they?.

conversation.ja_sentence: あー、この間M-Pの年次報告読みながら、震えちゃいましたよー！
conversation.en_sentence: Aww, I was trembling as I went through their annual report the other day!

conversation.ja_sentence: うわ、M-Pで働くの実際に考えられる後藤さんが羨ましいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Whoa, I'm so jealous that you can actually think of working there.

conversation.ja_sentence: その代わり、研究者として箔が付きますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Instead, you can build reputation as a researcher.

conversation.ja_sentence: 大抵みんな５年ぐらいで辞めちゃって、他でペイのいい仕事してるみたいですし。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems that most people quit after 5 years or so and get high-paid jobs elsewhere.

conversation.ja_sentence: 俺がもっとデキるなら、絶対入りたいですよー！
conversation.en_sentence: I would love to join them if I was capable enough!

conversation.ja_sentence: いや梶原さん、あそこからオファーが貰えるんなら、手弁当でも速攻行きますよ！
conversation.en_sentence: Well, Kanto, if I got an offer from them, I'd just fly there right away, even without pay!
